trans-unit.source: StorSimple failover and disaster recovery | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: StorSimple failover and disaster recovery | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to fail over your StorSimple device to itself, another physical device, or a virtual device.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to fail over your StorSimple device to itself, another physical device, or a virtual device.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes the steps required to fail over a StorSimple device in the event of a disaster.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes the steps required to fail over a StorSimple device in the event of a disaster.

trans-unit.source: A failover will allow you to migrate your data from a source device in the datacenter to another physical or even a virtual device located in the same or a different geographical location.
trans-unit.target: A failover will allow you to migrate your data from a source device in the datacenter to another physical or even a virtual device located in the same or a different geographical location.

trans-unit.source: Device failover is orchestrated via the disaster recovery (DR) feature and is initiated from the Devices page.
trans-unit.target: Device failover is orchestrated via the disaster recovery (DR) feature and is initiated from the Devices page.

trans-unit.source: This page tabulates all the StorSimple devices connected to your StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: This page tabulates all the StorSimple devices connected to your StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: For each device, the friendly name, status, provisioned and maximum capacity, type and model are displayed.
trans-unit.target: For each device, the friendly name, status, provisioned and maximum capacity, type and model are displayed.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Devices page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Devices page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a disaster recovery (DR) scenario, the primary device stops functioning.
trans-unit.target: In a disaster recovery (DR) scenario, the primary device stops functioning.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, you can move the cloud data associated with the failed device to another device by using the primary device as the source and specifying another device as the target.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, you can move the cloud data associated with the failed device to another device by using the primary device as the source and specifying another device as the target.

trans-unit.source: You can select one or more volume containers to migrate to the target device.
trans-unit.target: You can select one or more volume containers to migrate to the target device.

trans-unit.source: This process is referred to as the failover.
trans-unit.target: This process is referred to as the failover.

trans-unit.source: During the failover, the volume containers from the source device change ownership and are transferred to the target device.
trans-unit.target: During the failover, the volume containers from the source device change ownership and are transferred to the target device.

trans-unit.source: In the event of a disaster, you may choose to fail over your StorSimple device:
trans-unit.target: In the event of a disaster, you may choose to fail over your StorSimple device:

trans-unit.source: To a physical device
trans-unit.target: To a physical device

trans-unit.source: To itself
trans-unit.target: To itself

trans-unit.source: To a virtual device
trans-unit.target: To a virtual device

trans-unit.source: For any device failover, keep in mind the following:
trans-unit.target: For any device failover, keep in mind the following:

trans-unit.source: The prerequisites for DR are that all the volumes within the volume containers are offline and the volume containers have an associated cloud snapshot.
trans-unit.target: The prerequisites for DR are that all the volumes within the volume containers are offline and the volume containers have an associated cloud snapshot.

trans-unit.source: The available target devices for DR are devices that have sufficient space to accommodate the selected volume containers.
trans-unit.target: The available target devices for DR are devices that have sufficient space to accommodate the selected volume containers.

trans-unit.source: The devices that are connected to your service but do not meet the criteria of sufficient space will not be available as target devices.
trans-unit.target: The devices that are connected to your service but do not meet the criteria of sufficient space will not be available as target devices.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to restore your device to a target physical device.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to restore your device to a target physical device.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the volume container you want to fail over has associated cloud snapshots.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the volume container you want to fail over has associated cloud snapshots.

trans-unit.source: On the Devices page, click the Volume Containers tab.
trans-unit.target: On the Devices page, click the Volume Containers tab.

trans-unit.source: Select a volume container that you would like to fail over to another device.
trans-unit.target: Select a volume container that you would like to fail over to another device.

trans-unit.source: Click the volume container to display the list of volumes within this container.
trans-unit.target: Click the volume container to display the list of volumes within this container.

trans-unit.source: Select a volume and click Take Offline to take the volume offline.
trans-unit.target: Select a volume and click Take Offline to take the volume offline.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this process for all the volumes in the volume container.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this process for all the volumes in the volume container.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step for all the volume containers you would like to fail over to another device.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step for all the volume containers you would like to fail over to another device.

trans-unit.source: On the Devices page, click Failover.
trans-unit.target: On the Devices page, click Failover.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard that opens up, under Choose volume container to failover:
trans-unit.target: In the wizard that opens up, under Choose volume container to failover:

trans-unit.source: In the list of volume containers, select the volume containers you would like to fail over.
trans-unit.target: In the list of volume containers, select the volume containers you would like to fail over.

trans-unit.source: Only the volume containers with associated cloud snapshots and offline volumes are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Only the volume containers with associated cloud snapshots and offline volumes are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Under Choose a target device for the volumes in the selected containers, select a target device from the drop-down list of available devices.
trans-unit.target: Under Choose a target device for the volumes in the selected containers, select a target device from the drop-down list of available devices.

trans-unit.source: Only the devices that have the available capacity are displayed in the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Only the devices that have the available capacity are displayed in the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Finally, review all the failover settings under Confirm failover.
trans-unit.target: Finally, review all the failover settings under Confirm failover.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText>.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText>.

trans-unit.source: After the failover is completed, go to the Devices page.
trans-unit.target: After the failover is completed, go to the Devices page.

trans-unit.source: Select the device that was used as the target device for the failover process.
trans-unit.target: Select the device that was used as the target device for the failover process.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Volume Containers page.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Volume Containers page.

trans-unit.source: All the volume containers, along with the volumes from the old device, should be listed.
trans-unit.target: All the volume containers, along with the volumes from the old device, should be listed.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps if you only have a single device and need to perform a failover.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps if you only have a single device and need to perform a failover.

trans-unit.source: Take cloud snapshots of all the volumes in your device.
trans-unit.target: Take cloud snapshots of all the volumes in your device.

trans-unit.source: Reset your device to factory defaults.
trans-unit.target: Reset your device to factory defaults.

trans-unit.source: Follow the detailed instructions in <linkText>how to reset a StorSimple device to factory default settings</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Follow the detailed instructions in <linkText>how to reset a StorSimple device to factory default settings</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Configure your device and register it again with your StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: Configure your device and register it again with your StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: On the Devices page, the old device should show as Offline.
trans-unit.target: On the Devices page, the old device should show as Offline.

trans-unit.source: The newly registered device should show as Online.
trans-unit.target: The newly registered device should show as Online.

trans-unit.source: For the new device, complete the minimum configuration of the device first.
trans-unit.target: For the new device, complete the minimum configuration of the device first.

trans-unit.source: **If the minimum configuration is not completed first, your DR will fail as a result of a bug in the current implementation.
trans-unit.target: **If the minimum configuration is not completed first, your DR will fail as a result of a bug in the current implementation.

trans-unit.source: This behavior will be fixed in a later release.**
trans-unit.target: This behavior will be fixed in a later release.**

trans-unit.source: Select the old device (status offline) and click Failover.
trans-unit.target: Select the old device (status offline) and click Failover.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard that is presented, fail over this device and specify the target device as the newly registered device.
trans-unit.target: In the wizard that is presented, fail over this device and specify the target device as the newly registered device.

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, refer to <linkText>Fail over to another physical device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, refer to <linkText>Fail over to another physical device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A device restore job will be created that you can monitor from the Jobs page.
trans-unit.target: A device restore job will be created that you can monitor from the Jobs page.

trans-unit.source: After the job has successfully completed, access the new device and navigate to the Volume Containers page.
trans-unit.target: After the job has successfully completed, access the new device and navigate to the Volume Containers page.

trans-unit.source: All the volume containers from the old device should now be migrated to the new device.
trans-unit.target: All the volume containers from the old device should now be migrated to the new device.

trans-unit.source: You must have a StorSimple virtual device created and configured prior to running this procedure.
trans-unit.target: You must have a StorSimple virtual device created and configured prior to running this procedure.

trans-unit.source: In this release, the amount of storage supported on the StorSimple virtual device is 30 TB.
trans-unit.target: In this release, the amount of storage supported on the StorSimple virtual device is 30 TB.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to restore the device to a target StorSimple virtual device.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to restore the device to a target StorSimple virtual device.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the volume container you want to fail over has associated cloud snapshots.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the volume container you want to fail over has associated cloud snapshots.

trans-unit.source: On the Devices page, click the Volume Containers tab.
trans-unit.target: On the Devices page, click the Volume Containers tab.

trans-unit.source: Select a volume container that you would like to fail over to another device.
trans-unit.target: Select a volume container that you would like to fail over to another device.

trans-unit.source: Click the volume container to display the list of volumes within this container.
trans-unit.target: Click the volume container to display the list of volumes within this container.

trans-unit.source: Select a volume and click Take Offline to take the volume offline.
trans-unit.target: Select a volume and click Take Offline to take the volume offline.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this process for all the volumes in the volume container.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this process for all the volumes in the volume container.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step for all the volume containers you would like to fail over to another device.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step for all the volume containers you would like to fail over to another device.

trans-unit.source: On the Devices page, click Failover.
trans-unit.target: On the Devices page, click Failover.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard that opens up, under Choose volume container to failover, complete the following:
trans-unit.target: In the wizard that opens up, under Choose volume container to failover, complete the following:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: In the list of volume containers, select the volume containers you would like to fail over.
trans-unit.target: In the list of volume containers, select the volume containers you would like to fail over.

trans-unit.source: Only the volume containers with associated cloud snapshots and offline volumes are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Only the volume containers with associated cloud snapshots and offline volumes are displayed.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Under Choose a target device for the volumes in the selected containers, select the StorSimple virtual device from the drop-down list of available devices.
trans-unit.target: Under Choose a target device for the volumes in the selected containers, select the StorSimple virtual device from the drop-down list of available devices.

trans-unit.source: Only the devices that have sufficient capacity are displayed in the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Only the devices that have sufficient capacity are displayed in the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: **If your physical device is running Update 1, you can fail over to a virtual device running Update 1 only.
trans-unit.target: **If your physical device is running Update 1, you can fail over to a virtual device running Update 1 only.

trans-unit.source: If the target virtual device is running a lower software version, you will see an error to the effect that your target device software needs to be updated.**
trans-unit.target: If the target virtual device is running a lower software version, you will see an error to the effect that your target device software needs to be updated.**

trans-unit.source: Finally, review all the failover settings under Confirm failover.
trans-unit.target: Finally, review all the failover settings under Confirm failover.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText>.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText>.

trans-unit.source: After the failover is completed, go to the Devices page.
trans-unit.target: After the failover is completed, go to the Devices page.

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Select the StorSimple virtual device that was used as the target device for the failover process.
trans-unit.target: Select the StorSimple virtual device that was used as the target device for the failover process.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Volume Containers page.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Volume Containers page.

trans-unit.source: All the volume containers, along with the volumes from the old device should now be listed.
trans-unit.target: All the volume containers, along with the volumes from the old device should now be listed.

trans-unit.source: A business continuity disaster recovery (BCDR) scenario occurs when the entire Azure datacenter stops functioning.
trans-unit.target: A business continuity disaster recovery (BCDR) scenario occurs when the entire Azure datacenter stops functioning.

trans-unit.source: This can affect your StorSimple Manager service and the associated StorSimple devices.
trans-unit.target: This can affect your StorSimple Manager service and the associated StorSimple devices.

trans-unit.source: If there are StorSimple devices that were registered just before a disaster occurred, then these StorSimple devices may need to undergo a factory reset.
trans-unit.target: If there are StorSimple devices that were registered just before a disaster occurred, then these StorSimple devices may need to undergo a factory reset.

trans-unit.source: After the disaster, the StorSimple device will be shown as offline.
trans-unit.target: After the disaster, the StorSimple device will be shown as offline.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple device must be deleted from the portal, and a factory reset should be done, followed by a fresh registration.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple device must be deleted from the portal, and a factory reset should be done, followed by a fresh registration.

trans-unit.source: After you have performed a failover, you may need to:
trans-unit.target: After you have performed a failover, you may need to:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deactivate your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deactivate your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Delete your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Delete your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For information about how to manage your device using the StorSimple Manager service, go to <linkText>Use StorSimple Manager service to administer your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about how to manage your device using the StorSimple Manager service, go to <linkText>Use StorSimple Manager service to administer your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
